siteTitle: Yakup Delil Akın | Software Developer & Designer
hero-description: I'm Yakup Delil Akın. I blend aesthetics with high-performance code to craft unforgettable digital experiences for brands.
athleticocore-description: A real-time computer vision system that runs entirely in the browser, analyzes push-up form using camera input, counts repetitions, and generates performance metrics.
athleticocore-challenge-1: Maintaining real-time 25+ FPS on low-mid range devices
athleticocore-challenge-2: Accurate angle calculation across different body types and lighting
athleticocore-challenge-3: Browser camera permissions and privacy compliance
athleticocore-system-1: Camera input is captured via WebRTC.
athleticocore-system-2: Joint landmarks are extracted using MediaPipe Pose.
athleticocore-system-3: Angles and motion data are calculated in real time.
athleticocore-system-4: Instant feedback is provided when form degrades.
athleticocore-system-5: Analysis intensity is reduced automatically when FPS drops.
athleticocore-tech-1: All analysis runs fully client-side to minimize latency.
athleticocore-tech-2: Inference frequency is reduced when FPS drops below 20.
athleticocore-tech-3: Resolution is automatically optimized for mobile devices.
athleticocore-tech-4: No camera data is sent to external servers.
athleticocore-result-2: Over 83% form detection accuracy on test sets.
athletico-description: Designed to free athletes from manual training tracking methods. Offers full offline capability, local data storage, and cloud synchronization with Supabase.
athletico-challenge-3: Secure storage and privacy of user data
athletico-result-1: Smooth experience even in full offline mode
athletico-result-3: 40% faster data entry in user tests
footer-copyright: © 2026 Yakup Delil Akın. All Rights Reserved.
medibot-description: AI-powered education and health assistant developed for Teknofest, providing basic health information and guidance.
medibot-purpose-desc: Designed to increase health literacy, this bot provides general information based on user symptoms and directs to a specialist when necessary. Thanks to Large Language Models (LLM) integration, it can answer questions in natural language.
phantomlabs-description: Comprehensive offline endpoint analysis framework developed for forensic security research.
phantomlabs-challenge-1: Consistent and safe detection of system artifacts (Prefetch, Temp, Event Logs) on different Windows versions (Win10/11) while running completely offline and client-side — without interference from antivirus software.
phantomlabs-challenge-2: Precise measurement and reporting of environmental data such as CPU temperature, battery cycle, and disk usage across various hardware configurations (low RAM/CPU, old processors).
phantomlabs-challenge-3: Not publishing the full source code to minimize the risk of misuse, while effectively demonstrating the logical flow for educational purposes and ensuring the self-cleanup mechanism works flawlessly.
phantomlabs-challenge-4: Ensuring behavioral consistency across different test environments (virtual machine, physical device, domain joined vs standalone) and completing the analysis cycle without leaving forensic-safe artifacts.
phantomlabs-system-1: Inventory Collection: CPU, RAM, OS version, installed security software, and hardware information are collected; all data is written to the local system_report.txt file.
phantomlabs-system-2: Network and Connectivity Analysis: Local IP, network interfaces, and basic connectivity mapping are performed (offline modules are used for network discovery).
phantomlabs-system-3: Media and Peripheral Test: Hardware compatibility is verified via screenshot and camera driver test (peripheral_test.jpg is created).
phantomlabs-system-4: Artifact and Forensics Monitoring: Windows Prefetch, Temp folders, and other digital traces are scanned; footprints left by the software on the system are reported.
phantomlabs-system-5: Environmental Monitoring: Metrics such as CPU temperature, battery cycle count, and disk usage rate are recorded in the health_log.txt file.
phantomlabs-system-6: Cleanup and Closure: After analysis is complete, all temporary log and artifact files are automatically deleted (self-cleanup & final cleanup); the system reverts to its original state without leaving a trace.
phantomlabs-tech-1: All analysis operations run completely offline and locally — no data is sent to the network or server; to ensure 100% privacy and forensic security.
phantomlabs-tech-2: System integrity is preserved even in educational use with modular structure (each version adds a separate focus area) and debug/self-cleanup mechanisms.
phantomlabs-tech-3: Full source code is not published; only examples showing the logical flow are shared — a conscious choice to minimize the risk of misuse.
phantomlabs-tech-4: Environmental metrics (temperature, battery, disk) are fetched with psutil or similar libraries; optimized for low resource consumption.
phantomlabs-tech-5: The analysis cycle was made compliant with digital forensics standards via a three-stage methodology (inventory → behavior observation → cleanup).
phantomlabs-result-1: As of v13.0, a comprehensive offline endpoint analysis framework is completed; all modules are integrated and leave no trace with self-cleanup.
phantomlabs-result-2: Artifact detection and environmental monitoring worked 100% consistently in different test environments (Win10/11, low-mid range hardware).
phantomlabs-result-3: It succeeded in effectively demonstrating system analysis methodologies for educational use; the risk of misuse was kept near zero.
phantomlabs-result-4: It became a safe educational tool for ethical security research with zero network dependency and completely local processing.
